chart.title: Fishing intensity by region
chart.subtitle: Fishing intensity measures the extent to which a stock is being exploited. Here, it's measured as current fishing intensity divided by the intensity at the [maximum sustainable yield](#dod:msy). A value of one is the optimal level to maximize fish catch without causing fish population. Greater than one suggests overfishing.
chart.citation: RAM Legacy Database; Hilborn,et al. (2020). Effective fisheries management instrumental in improving fish stock status.
